sentences.english: I can think of the most romantic thing is to learn social dance.
sentences.chinese: 我能想到的最浪漫的事，就是学会跳交谊舞。

sentences.english: Shu Bote living in classicism and romanticism of the transition period.
sentences.chinese: 舒柏特生活在古典主义和浪漫主义的交接时期。

sentences.english: Elizabeth liked to read poetry and romantic stories.
sentences.chinese: 伊丽莎白喜欢读诗和浪漫小说。

sentences.english: Romance is seeing flowers withering away you want to cry.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫是瞧见花将凋零想哭泣。

sentences.english: To love oneself is the beginning o...
sentences.chinese: 爱自己是一场毕生浪漫的开始。

sentences.english: A Romanticist reading comic books under the tree, loves to be in a daydreaming.
sentences.chinese: 阿浪漫主义读漫画书的树，喜欢在一个白日梦。

sentences.english: As far as the writing technique is concerned, the Tang poetry combined realism and romanticism.
sentences.chinese: 唐诗在创作方法上，现实主义与浪漫主义并举。

sentences.english: Just what is this desire, this wish that Xie Nanxing brands 'romantic'?
sentences.chinese: 谢南星评价为“浪漫”的这种欲望或希望到底是什么？

sentences.english: Sure, it's a mistake to romanticize all this any more than is strictly necessary.
sentences.chinese: 当然，没有必要地把这一切过分浪漫化。

sentences.english: The portrait, painted in a simple but elegant style, has a romantic flavor.
sentences.chinese: 画面墨淡气雅，设色颇有浪漫主义韵味。

sentences.english: We have lots of romantic ideas for a heavenly Maui wedding.
sentences.chinese: 我们有很多的想法天毛伊浪漫婚礼。

sentences.english: The beautiful topiary trees are witnesses of our marriage.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫鲜花柱见证我们的婚盟约誓。

sentences.english: This window of fun and frivolity is also fabulous time for love affairs and romance.
sentences.chinese: 这个轻松娱乐的时刻也非常适合爱情和浪漫。

sentences.english: Byron and Shelley are usually considered as the Second Generation of the Romanic Movement.
sentences.chinese: 拜伦和雪莱通常被认为是浪漫运动的第二代。

sentences.english: Therefore, when you begin romancing her, sooner or later she'll start to do the same.
sentences.chinese: 所以，当你开始为她浪漫时，迟早她也会做同样的事。

sentences.english: Make sex and romance fun in your marriage.
sentences.chinese: 在你的婚姻中制造性感和浪漫。

definition: in love with/to feel deeply attached to
wind, flower, snow and moon, trite poetry subject (idiom); effete language without substance/love affair/romance is in the air/dissipated life
